claim.claim-text: 1. A method for forming a three-dimensional (3D) memory device, comprising:forming a dielectric stack comprising a plurality of first/second dielectric layer pairs over a substrate;forming a plurality of channel structures extending in a lateral direction in a core region of the dielectric stack;forming a staircase structure comprising a plurality of stairs extending along the lateral direction in a staircase region of the dielectric stack;forming a first drain-select-gate (DSG) cut opening extending in the lateral direction in the core region and a second DSG cut opening in the staircase region; andforming a first DSG cut structure in the first DSG cut opening and a second DSG cut structure in the second DSG cut opening.

2. The method of claim 1, wherein forming the dielectric stack comprising the plurality of first/second dielectric layer pairs over the substrate, comprises:forming a lower dielectric stack comprising the plurality of first/second dielectric layer pairs over the substrate; andforming an upper dielectric stack comprising the plurality of first/second dielectric layer pairs over the substrate.

3. The method of claim 2, wherein forming the plurality of channel structures extending in the lateral direction in the core region of the dielectric stack, comprises:forming a plurality of lower channel holes extending in the lateral direction in the lower dielectric stack;after forming the upper dielectric stack, forming a plurality of upper channel holes extending in the lateral direction in the upper dielectric stack aligning the plurality of lower channel holes; andforming the plurality of channel structures in the plurality of upper channel holes and the plurality of lower channel holes.

4. The method of claim 1, wherein forming the first DSG cut opening extending in the lateral direction in the core region and the second DSG cut opening in the staircase region, comprises:forming the first DSG cut opening in the core region and the second DSG cut opening in the staircase region by a same fabrication operation.
5. The method of claim 4, wherein the second DSG cut opening in the staircase region aligned with the first DSG cut opening in the lateral direction.

6. The method of claim 1, wherein forming the first DSG cut opening extending in the lateral direction in the core region and the second DSG cut opening in the staircase region, comprises:removing a portion of the dielectric stack in the core region and an upper portion of plurality of channel structures.
7. The method of claim 6, wherein a depth of the first DSG cut opening is at least four first/second dielectric layer pairs in the core region.
8. The method of claim 6, wherein a depth of the second DSG cut opening is equal to or greater than four first/second dielectric layer pairs in the staircase region.

9. The method of claim 1, wherein forming the first DSG cut structure in the first DSG cut opening and the second DSG cut structure in the second DSG cut opening, comprises:forming a dielectric material in the first DSG cut opening and the second DSG cut opening by a same fabrication operation.

10. The method of claim 1, further comprising:after forming the second DSG cut structure in the second DSG cut opening, forming a plurality of support openings extending along a vertical direction in the staircase region and being at least partially overlapped with the second DSG cut structure; andforming a plurality of support structures in the plurality of support openings.

11. The method of claim 10, wherein forming the plurality of support openings extending along the vertical direction in the staircase region and being at least partially overlapped with the second DSG cut structure, comprises:removing a portion of the second DSG cut structure and a portion of the dielectric stack in the staircase region.
12. The method of claim 11, wherein the plurality of support openings extend to a bottom of the dielectric stack in the staircase region.

13. The method of claim 11, wherein forming the plurality of support structures in the plurality of support openings, comprises:forming a first portion of the plurality of support structures aligning with the second DSG cut structure; andforming a second portion of the plurality of support structures extending outside of the second DSG cut structure.

14. The method of claim 1, wherein forming the first DSG cut opening extending in the lateral direction in the core region and the second DSG cut opening in the staircase region, comprises:removing an upper portion of plurality of channel structures.
15. The method of claim 1, further comprising:replacing the plurality of first dielectric layers with a plurality of conductor layers.

16. A method for forming a three-dimensional (3D) memory device, comprising:forming a dielectric stack comprising a plurality of first/second dielectric layer pairs over a substrate;forming a plurality of channel structures extending in a lateral direction in a core region of the dielectric stack;forming a staircase structure comprising a plurality of stairs extending along the lateral direction in a staircase region of the dielectric stack; andforming a first drain-select-gate (DSG) cut structure extending in the lateral direction in the core region and a second DSG cut structure in the staircase region by a same fabrication operation.

17. The method of claim 15, wherein forming the first DSG cut structure extending in the lateral direction in the core region and the second DSG cut structure in the staircase region by the same fabrication operation, comprises:after forming the staircase structure, forming a first DSG cut opening extending in the lateral direction in the core region and a second DSG cut opening in the staircase region by a same removing operation; andforming the first DSG cut structure in the first DSG cut opening and the second DSG cut structure in the second DSG cut opening by a same forming operation.

18. A method for forming a three-dimensional (3D) memory device, comprising:forming a dielectric stack comprising a plurality of first/second dielectric layer pairs over a substrate;forming a first drain-select-gate (DSG) cut opening in a core region of the dielectric stack;forming a staircase structure comprising a plurality of stairs extending along a lateral direction in a staircase region of the dielectric stack;forming, in a different step than the first DSG cut opening, a second DSG cut opening in the staircase region and extending along the lateral direction;depositing a dielectric material to respectively fill up the first DSG cut opening and the second DSG cut opening; andforming a first DSG cut structure in the first DSG cut opening and a second DSG cut structure in the second DSG cut opening, wherein the first DSG cut structure and the second DSG cut structure are each a dielectric structure.
19. The method of claim 18, wherein the first DSG cut opening and the second DSG cut opening are formed by a same fabrication operation.
20. The method of claim 18, further comprising:replacing the plurality of first dielectric layers with a plurality of conductor layers.
